p: Hydroxychloroquine sulfate, a derivative form of chloroquine, was first synthesized in 1946 by introducing a hydroxyl group into chloroquine. It has two to three times less toxicity in animals compared to chloroquine [ 154]. Hydroxychloroquine likely has the same mechanism of action on viruses as that of chloroquine and acts as a weak base compound, changing the pH of endosomes/lysosomes [ 155].
